form.name: diarrheoa_with_some_dehydration
form.page_subtitle: CWC Diagnostic: Assessment of Child: Main Symptoms: Diarrhoea> Diarrheoa with Some Dehydration

field.name: Restless or irritable | Sunken eyes | Drinks eagerly, thirsty | Skin pinch goes back slowly.
Take Action: Diarrheoa with Some Dehydration
If child has also got another severe classification or condition after assessment:
Refer the child to a health center or hospital IMMEDIATELY
Prepare ORS
Advise mother to be giving frequent sips of ORS one the way to higher health facility, if child can take sips
Advise mother to continue breastfeeding if still breastfeeding
If child has No Other severe classification or condition:
Give recommended amount of ORS over 4-hour period in your facility:
child_assessment_diarrhoea/diarrheoa_with_some_dehydration.JPG
If the child wants more ORS than shown, give more
Continue treatment with fluid, food and zinc supplements for some dehydration –Plan B
Give Zinc Tablet [Age: 2months to 5 years] for 14 days
TELL THE MOTHER HOW MUCH ZINC TO GIVE (20 mg tab) : 2 months up to 6 months— 1/2 tablet daily for 14 days 6 months or more —1 tablet daily for 14 days
Advise mother on when to return for care immediately per table below: WHEN TO RETURN IMMEDIATELY
child_assessment_diarrhoea/when_to_return_diarrhoea.JPG
While waiting for transport:
Observe mother breastfeeding and counsel her on positioning and attachment if necessary.
Counsel mother on feeding a sick child
Advise caregiver to return after 5 days if condition is not improving
Discharge caregiver and child and document
